sn47.24:1.2: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.24:1.4: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.24:1.5: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.24:1.7: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.24:1.8: These are the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
